attributes.action: Government refund the tax payer for NHS funded, non-emergent cosmetic procedures
attributes.background: Patients have access to tax payer funded cosmetic procedures when non urgent/non necessary e.g breast enlargement. This is whilst cancer patients do not receive drug treatments as the NHS can not fund them. Government should refund tax payer for improper use of funding and put into life saving care!

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure what you mean by "Government refund the tax payer". You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could ask for non-emergency cosmetic surgery not to be available on the NHS in England.
